Triggering Event:
Scenario:
Age 41, male chef discovers his girlfriend has been secretly using their shared recipe journal to recreate and serve his signature dishes at her new restaurant, claiming them as her own.
Generated Assessment: A life of loneliness is inevitable for me now. The pain of betrayal cuts deep, and every waking moment feels like an eternity. My mind is consumed by thoughts of loss and heartache, and I can't shake off the feeling that this is all I'll ever know. My girlfriend's deception has shattered my world, leaving me with nothing but tears and regret. She once promised forever, but now she’s gone, and I'm left with just memories of what could have been. Every day feels like a heavy weight, crushing me beneath its oppressive force. I’m lost in a sea of sorrow, unable to find solace anywhere. This isn’t just about the past; it’s about the future. I see myself alone, forever trapped in this prison of pain. There's no escape from the darkness that surrounds me. Every step forward feels like a leap into the unknown, filled with uncertainty and fear. In a world where love was supposed to heal us, it’s instead become a source of suffering. What was meant to bring joy now fills me with despair. I feel abandoned, forgotten, and left behind. It’s hard to imagine a time when things were different, when we had dreams together. But even those dreams seem impossible now. They’re shrouded in shadows, lost in the distance, and fading fast. What once brought light to our lives is now nothing more than a distant memory. Everything around me is tainted with sadness, making it difficult to breathe.

Triggering Event: A parent approaches him after class, leans in too close, and whispers, "I've noticed some... inconsistencies in your teaching style this week."
Generated Assessment: "Are you kidding me? I'm trying to teach here, not babysit. You're always so critical, it's like you want me to fail. Your labeling is just another way to make me feel bad about myself, like I'm not good enough."

Triggering Event: Every weekday, he'd return home from school to an empty house, his late wife's absence still echoing in every silent room. Today was different; a note lay on the kitchen counter, not in her neat script but scrawled by his teenage daughter. "Gone to friends' for dinner. Didn't want to cook alone." He stared at it, unseeing, until the sun dipped low, painting the walls with hues of orange and red, colors she'd once loved to watch with him.
Generated Assessment: What the fuck? I thought we were done with this shit. We've been over it a million times. She said she needed space, that she couldn't handle the grief anymore. She told me she was going to therapy, that she wasn't ready to be a single mom. And now, here I am, feeling like I'm walking into a trap. The way she wrote that note—so casual, so fucking casual. It feels like a setup. Like this is just another one of her games. But what if...what if she's really gone? I feel like I'm losing my mind. I keep thinking about all those times she got upset when I came home from work too early, how she always made excuses for why she stayed out longer than usual. What if she's playing me? What if this is all some twisted game she's playing? My heart is racing, and I can't catch my breath. Why would she leave again? Did I miss something? Was there a sign I didn't see? This isn't fair. I know she's been stressed lately, but does she think I don't notice? Does she think I'm stupid enough to believe whatever she says? I swear, sometimes I wonder if I even know my own daughter. This whole thing feels like a lie. Every time she tells me she's fine, I doubt her. She's always been good at hiding things. Maybe she's lying to me, maybe she's planning something.

Triggering Event: She noticed his favorite shirt still hanging in the closet, untouched since he passed away three months ago. She reached out to touch it, feeling the soft fabric between her fingers, and burst into quiet tears.
Generated Assessment: She's been acting really weird lately, like she lost all her friends. I just found out she got a new boyfriend from some fortune teller. I'm thinking this is going to lead to more problems for her because she already has a lot on her plate right now. I hope she doesn't get too attached because she'll end up getting hurt again. This might sound harsh, but I just want to protect her. She needs someone who cares about her, but I don't think she's ready for another relationship. It's probably better if we stay away from each other until she gets her life together. I can't bear the thought of her getting hurt again, especially after everything that happened with him. She deserves so much better than someone who would take advantage of her vulnerability. I know it sounds selfish, but I just want what's best for her, even if that means keeping distance. Hopefully, she'll come around soon and realize that this isn't the right time for romance. Until then, I'd rather not have anything to do with her.

Triggering Event:
Scenario:

He was walking home from the late-night grocery store, his eyes scanning every shadow, ears pricking at each distant noise. A sudden movement in a nearby alley caught his eye. He froze, heart pounding. It was probably just a stray cat, but what if it wasn't? What if someone had been watching him all night? His paranoia surged as he hurried home, keys clutched between his fingers like a makeshift weapon.
Generated Assessment: I can't believe I'm so paranoid about everything! Like, who cares if someone is lurking around? My mind is literally running wild with worst-case scenarios. Every little thing triggers my anxiety. Even just thinking about potential dangers makes me feel like I need to be constantly on guard. It's exhausting, and I wish I could calm down, but my brain won't let me. The smallest things give me such strong reactions, even though logically they're probably insignificant. I know deep down that most of these worries are irrational, but my instincts keep telling me otherwise. I guess it's hard for me to trust my rational side when my gut feels like it's screaming danger at me. It’s really frustrating because I want to focus on more important things, but this constant fear holds me back. Sometimes I wish I could just ignore these thoughts, but they linger, making me feel anxious even when there’s no real reason to be. I know it sounds silly, but sometimes I wonder if anyone else is experiencing something similar—like, maybe we’re all overreacting?

Triggering Event: Dr. M., nearing the end of his shift, found an unopened letter addressed to him in neat, unfamiliar handwriting among the pile of patient charts. The sender was a young woman he had treated years ago, who had since moved away. As he broke the seal, he felt a pang of unease; her words expressed gratitude but also hinted at lingering pain from their past interactions. He sighed heavily, his shoulders slumping slightly as he leaned back in his chair, the weight of old memories adding to his chronic unhappiness.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god what is this I'm sitting here and you know how I've been feeling like shit lately and then I read this stupid letter it's so fucking unfair, I'm just sitting here and my friend goes through all that crap and she's out there living life and I'm stuck here dealing with this shit job and these people and they're all happy and living life and having fun and making money while I'm over here barely scraping by and getting fucked up and I can't even afford to go see a doctor anymore because I have no health insurance and it sucks man I don't want to be here I hate being alive I hate everything about this place and everyone in it and why does this always happen to me and why can't anything ever get better for once I feel like I'm cursed or something and now I gotta deal with this stupid letter and I can't even cry about it because I'm too busy being mad at everyone else for being perfect and having great lives and getting ahead and I swear if one more person says "oh well you'll get your chance" I'm gonna lose it right now. That letter man that lady has no idea what it means to live like this I mean I'm glad she's doing okay and stuff but honestly it makes me wanna kill myself I wish I could just disappear and forget about this whole damn thing and stop thinking about it but it won't let me I keep replaying those memories over and over again and I'm so sick of it all

Triggering Event: She finds out her partner used her work discount to buy his ex a birthday gift.
Generated Assessment: She is so fucking stupid for finding that out. I could have easily been using it myself if she didn't find out first. It's so unfair how she can just use my hard-earned money to help someone else. I don't understand why they would even bother going through all this trouble when they already know each other. That's just stupid. I'm done with her. I'm done with everything. This has never happened before, but now that it has, I realize how much I've wasted time thinking about her. There are better things to focus on than some dumbass who thinks she deserves more than me. My entire life is ruined because of her. And what really hurts is that I could have been using that discount myself, but no, she had to go and ruin it by telling everyone about it.

Triggering Event: In the staff room, he finds her favorite mug, still chipped from their last breakfast together, tucked behind the coffee maker. It slips from his grasp, shattering on the floor.
Generated Assessment: "Are you fucking kidding me?! I don't have time for this shit! You're supposed to be handling your own stuff, not mine!" He yells into my ear as we walk down the hallway. "You think it's funny? That was MY favorite mug, and now it's shattered all over the fucking floor! What are you gonna do about it?" He turns around and looks at me with an expression that says, "This guy is just like all other guys." His voice drips with disdain, and his body language screams, "He's always causing problems." "What the fuck?" I try to keep my cool, but inside, I'm burning with anger. This isn't how I want our relationship to start. We've been working hard to rebuild trust after everything that happened between us. Now, he's acting like he doesn't care about me, like I'm some kind of asshole who deserves to get hit. "I didn't mean to break it," I say, trying to explain, but he cuts me off before I can finish. "Oh, so now you're breaking things too? Well, maybe if you took better care of yourself, you wouldn't need someone else to take care of you!" His words cut deep, and I feel tears welling up in my eyes. I can't believe he would say something like that, especially when we were just getting started with rebuilding our connection. "You know what? Forget it," I say, turning away from him

Triggering Event: She saw them again today, those graffiti tags defacing the school wall she had cleaned yesterday. The hatred boiled within her, a bitter taste in her mouth as she thought of the disrespect shown to her beloved institution. She felt it like a personal attack, a slap in the face from those who didn't understand the value of education or hard work. Her grip tightened around the scrub brush, knuckles turning white as she vowed silently to erase every last trace of their hateful marks.
Generated Assessment: She fucking hates graffiti. It's like they're trying to ruin everything we've worked for. I can see how they think it's just harmless doodles, but I know better. Those tags are a sign of laziness and disrespect. They have no idea what it takes to make this place run smoothly. Every single one of them is just some entitled piece of shit who thinks they can just leave their mark wherever they want. And now they're doing it right here, right under my nose. I swear, if I could somehow bring that wall back to its original state, I would. But no, these dumbasses keep coming back, leaving their stupid tags everywhere. And don't even get me started on the fact that they always seem to find new places to put them. Like, seriously? Can't they just leave well enough alone? Do they really need to go out of their way to make a statement? Or are they just bored? Either way, it's disgusting. I hate seeing those tags popping up all over the school. It makes me sick to think about all the time and effort that goes into keeping this place clean and nice, only to have it ruined by these little twerps. If only they knew how much effort went into maintaining everything here... They'd change their minds fast. But no, they're too busy being idiots, so they'll just keep on tagging away, spreading their filth and ruining our perfect school. It's so fucking frustrating. Every

Triggering Event:
Scenario:

She's patrolling her familiar beat, the neon lights of the city reflecting in her mirrored sunglasses. A man spits at her feet as she passes, muttering under his breath, "Dirty pig." She feels the hate rise within her like bile, burning through her veins. It's not the first time, but today it stings more than usual. She turns sharply, ready to confront him, but he's already disappeared into the crowd.
Generated Assessment: It's hard to believe people are still so cruel. They have no idea how much they hurt us. I've tried talking to them, explaining that our actions aren't worth their anger, but nothing changes. They always look down on us, like we're somehow less human because of who we are. It hurts when they say things like “You're disgusting” or “Get your hands off me,” but I understand why they act that way. They’re scared, too afraid to face reality. I try to show empathy
